behaviors.tw_2: Actively looks for opportunities to help.
behaviors.tw_3: Knows how to give and receive honest, helpful feedback.
behaviors.tw_4: Maximizes the benefits of collaborative tools.

behaviors.lgt_2: Prioritizes work and quickly decides which resource or tool is best suited to solve a problem.
behaviors.lgt_3: Analyzes approach often and makes adjustments as needed.
behaviors.lgt_4: Trusts what can be verified; recognizes all else as belief.

behaviors.euf_1: Develops solutions based on "fit" rather than potential difficulty of implementation.
behaviors.euf_2: Consistently refers back to the user story and user persona to make decisions.
behaviors.euf_3: Takes due dates seriously and strives to finish work on time.
behaviors.euf_4: Actively seeks feedback from potential users.

behaviors.cr_1: Asks meaningful questions to understand more.
behaviors.cr_2: Looks forward to trying something new and unfamiliar.
behaviors.cr_3: Looks for experience in a variety of areas and disciplines. (UI design, cybersecurity, QA testing, including common terminology and tools).
behaviors.cr_4: Seeks to know the 'why' behind tasks.

competencies.name: Grit
competencies.definition: Passion and perseverance for long term and meaningful goals.

behaviors.gr_1: Adapts quickly to changing circumstances and unforeseen issues.
behaviors.gr_3: "Doubles down" when feeling unsure or confused; takes breaks when appropriate.
behaviors.gr_4: Feels confident that every problem has a solution.
behaviors.gr_5: Sees success as a mindset, not as a result.

behaviors.lsh_4: "Owns" the project at any level of seniority.
behaviors.lsh_5: Confidently and intentionally accepts self, others, circumstances, and outcomes.

competencies.name: Confidence
competencies.definition: A perception of self as a capable individual.

behaviors.cf_1: Believe that all your limitations can be overcome.
behaviors.cf_2: Takes risks that are thoughtful & calculated.
behaviors.cf_3: Comfortable with (and eventually excited by) complex challenges beyond current ability level. Cast the "dead, rigid, and too tyrannical order back into the chaos in which it was generated."

detractors.d_cf_1: Thinks, "who am I to solve this?"

competencies.name: Hope
competencies.definition: A perception of the world as a generally positive place where bad things and good things happen.

behaviors.h_1: Understands how to work within an iterative environment.
behaviors.h_2: Recognizes potential to achieve anything with sufficient time and effort.

detractors.d_h_1: Thinks, "we can't change anything, it just is how it is."
